text: Businesses aren't allowed to ask customers if they’ve been vaccinated because there are HIPPA laws.
Businesses can ask customers if they have been vaccinated against COVID-19 without legal repercussions.
Businesses cannot legally ask for proof of vaccination and cannot deny entry based on vaccination status.
Says showing up at the front doors of people’s houses and violating HIPAA laws by requesting private medical information regarding their vaccination status is unacceptable and illegal.
Questions about whether she’s been vaccinated are a violation of my HIPAA rights.
